sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_update_xml"><sys_update_xml action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><action>INSERT_OR_UPDATE</action><application display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</application><category>customer</category><comments/><name>sys_script_include_b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02</name><payload><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_include"><sys_script_include action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><access>package_private</access><active>true</active><api_name>x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2RemediationHelper</api_name><caller_access/><client_callable>true</client_callable><description/><mobile_callable>false</mobile_callable><name>EC2RemediationHelper</name><sandbox_callable>false</sandbox_callable><script><![CDATA[var EC2RemediationHelper = Class.create();
EC2RemediationHelper.prototype = Object.extendsObject(
  global.AbstractAjaxProcessor,
  {
    triggerRemediation: function () {
      var ec2SysId = this.getParameter('sysparm_ec2_sys_id');

      try {
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: ec2SysId=' + ec2SysId);

        if (!ec2SysId) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'Missing required parameter: sysparm_ec2_sys_id',
          });
        }

        // Look up the EC2 instance record
        var ec2Gr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_instance');
        if (!ec2Gr.get(ec2SysId)) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'EC2 Instance record not found',
          });
        }

        var instanceId = ec2Gr.getValue('instance_id');
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: Found instanceId=' + instanceId);

        // Get credentials from connection store
        var aliasGr = new GlideRecord('sys_alias');
        aliasGr.addQuery('name', 'AWS Integration Server C C Alias');
        aliasGr.query();
        aliasGr.next();
        var aliasSysId = aliasGr.getUniqueValue();

        var connectionInfo =
          new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider().getConnectionInfoByDomain(
            aliasSysId,
            'global'
          );
        var username = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('user_name');
        var password = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('password');
        var connectionUrl = connectionInfo.getAttribute('connection_url');

        // Make API call
        var request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2();
        request.setEndpoint(connectionUrl);
        request.setHttpMethod('POST');
        request.setBasicAuth(username, password);
        request.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
        request.setRequestHeader('Accept', 'application/json');

        var requestBody = JSON.stringify({instance_id: instanceId});
        request.setRequestBody(requestBody);

        var startTime = new Date().getTime();
        var response = request.execute();
        var endTime = new Date().getTime();
        var responseTime = endTime - startTime;

        var httpStatusCode = response.getStatusCode();
        var responseBody = response.getBody();
        var errorMessage = response.getErrorMessage();
        var isSuccess = httpStatusCode >= 200 && httpStatusCode < 300;

        gs.info(
          'EC2RemediationHelper: API Response - Status: ' +
            httpStatusCode +
            ', Body: ' +
            responseBody
        );

        // error message with details
        var fullErrorMessage = null;
        if (!isSuccess) {
          fullErrorMessage = 'API call failed - HTTP ' + httpStatusCode;
          if (errorMessage) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nError: ' + errorMessage;
          }
          if (responseBody) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nResponse: ' + responseBody;
          }
        }

        // Create remediation log entry
        var logGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        logGr.initialize();
        logGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId);
        logGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        logGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        logGr.setValue('request_payload', requestBody);
        logGr.setValue('success', isSuccess);
        logGr.setValue('response_payload', responseBody);
        logGr.setValue('http_status_code', httpStatusCode);
        logGr.setValue('response_time_ms', responseTime);

        if (fullErrorMessage) {
          logGr.setValue('error_message', fullErrorMessage);
        }

        var logId = logGr.insert();
        gs.info('Created log entry: ' + logId);

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: isSuccess,
          message: isSuccess
            ? 'Instance start request sent successfully!'
            : fullErrorMessage,
          log_id: logId,
          instance_id: instanceId,
          http_status: httpStatusCode,
          response_time_ms: responseTime,
        });
      } catch (e) {
        var errorMsg = 'Exception in triggerRemediation: ' + e.message;
        var stackTrace = e.stack || 'Stack trace not available';

        gs.error('EC2RemediationHelper error: ' + errorMsg);
        gs.error('Stack trace: ' + stackTrace);

        // Log error with full stack trace
        var errorLogGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        errorLogGr.initialize();
        errorLogGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId || 'unknown');
        errorLogGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        errorLogGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        errorLogGr.setValue('success', false);
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'response_payload',
          'Exception: ' + errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'error_message',
          errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue('http_status_code', 0);
        errorLogGr.setValue('response_time_ms', 0);
        errorLogGr.insert();

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: false,
          message: errorMsg,
          stack_trace: stackTrace,
        });
      }
    },

    type: 'EC2RemediationHelper',
  }
);]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_include</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-11 02:15:24</sys_created_on><sys_id>b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2RemediationHelper</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_package><sys_policy>read</sys_policy><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_include_b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-12 05:28:55</sys_updated_on></sys_script_include></record_update></payload><payload_hash>-1888515533</payload_hash><remote_update_set/><replace_on_upgrade>false</replace_on_upgrade><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-11 02:15:25</sys_created_on><sys_id>33ab2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c15</sys_id><sys_mod_count>3</sys_mod_count><sys_recorded_at>1993c65e7f60000001</sys_recorded_at><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-12 05:28:55</sys_updated_on><table/><target_name>EC2RemediationHelper</target_name><type>Script Include</type><update_domain>global</update_domain><update_guid>809129f3edb7221049ae929ee76e0802</update_guid><update_guid_history>809129f3edb7221049ae929ee76e0802:-1888515533,87bb271358b322101bb55e336e88bcd3:-972671287,3fab2b1356b32210d8b92333b35dda14:-1563289178</update_guid_history><update_set display_value="EC2 Monitiring and Remediation 2 ">8d17728b9fbb22107f440f42b824abaa</update_set><view/></sys_update_xml></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sys_script_include_b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_include"><sys_script_include action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><access>package_private</access><active>true</active><api_name>x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2RemediationHelper</api_name><caller_access/><client_callable>true</client_callable><description/><mobile_callable>false</mobile_callable><name>EC2RemediationHelper</name><sandbox_callable>false</sandbox_callable><script><![CDATA[var EC2RemediationHelper = Class.create();
EC2RemediationHelper.prototype = Object.extendsObject(
  global.AbstractAjaxProcessor,
  {
    triggerRemediation: function () {
      var ec2SysId = this.getParameter('sysparm_ec2_sys_id');

      try {
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: ec2SysId=' + ec2SysId);

        if (!ec2SysId) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'Missing required parameter: sysparm_ec2_sys_id',
          });
        }

        // Look up the EC2 instance record
        var ec2Gr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_instance');
        if (!ec2Gr.get(ec2SysId)) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'EC2 Instance record not found',
          });
        }

        var instanceId = ec2Gr.getValue('instance_id');
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: Found instanceId=' + instanceId);

        // Get credentials from connection store
        var aliasGr = new GlideRecord('sys_alias');
        aliasGr.addQuery('name', 'AWS Integration Server C C Alias');
        aliasGr.query();
        aliasGr.next();
        var aliasSysId = aliasGr.getUniqueValue();

        var connectionInfo =
          new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider().getConnectionInfoByDomain(
            aliasSysId,
            'global'
          );
        var username = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('user_name');
        var password = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('password');
        var connectionUrl = connectionInfo.getAttribute('connection_url');

        // Make API call
        var request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2();
        request.setEndpoint(connectionUrl);
        request.setHttpMethod('POST');
        request.setBasicAuth(username, password);
        request.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
        request.setRequestHeader('Accept', 'application/json');

        var requestBody = JSON.stringify({instance_id: instanceId});
        request.setRequestBody(requestBody);

        var startTime = new Date().getTime();
        var response = request.execute();
        var endTime = new Date().getTime();
        var responseTime = endTime - startTime;

        var httpStatusCode = response.getStatusCode();
        var responseBody = response.getBody();
        var errorMessage = response.getErrorMessage();
        var isSuccess = httpStatusCode >= 200 && httpStatusCode < 300;

        gs.info(
          'EC2RemediationHelper: API Response - Status: ' +
            httpStatusCode +
            ', Body: ' +
            responseBody
        );

        // error message with details
        var fullErrorMessage = null;
        if (!isSuccess) {
          fullErrorMessage = 'API call failed - HTTP ' + httpStatusCode;
          if (errorMessage) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nError: ' + errorMessage;
          }
          if (responseBody) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nResponse: ' + responseBody;
          }
        }

        // Create remediation log entry
        var logGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        logGr.initialize();
        logGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId);
        logGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        logGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        logGr.setValue('request_payload', requestBody);
        logGr.setValue('success', isSuccess);
        logGr.setValue('response_payload', responseBody);
        logGr.setValue('http_status_code', httpStatusCode);
        logGr.setValue('response_time_ms', responseTime);

        if (fullErrorMessage) {
          logGr.setValue('error_message', fullErrorMessage);
        }

        var logId = logGr.insert();
        gs.info('Created log entry: ' + logId);

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: isSuccess,
          message: isSuccess
            ? 'Instance start request sent successfully!'
            : fullErrorMessage,
          log_id: logId,
          instance_id: instanceId,
          http_status: httpStatusCode,
          response_time_ms: responseTime,
        });
      } catch (e) {
        var errorMsg = 'Exception in triggerRemediation: ' + e.message;
        var stackTrace = e.stack || 'Stack trace not available';

        gs.error('EC2RemediationHelper error: ' + errorMsg);
        gs.error('Stack trace: ' + stackTrace);

        // Log error with full stack trace
        var errorLogGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        errorLogGr.initialize();
        errorLogGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId || 'unknown');
        errorLogGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        errorLogGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        errorLogGr.setValue('success', false);
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'response_payload',
          'Exception: ' + errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'error_message',
          errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue('http_status_code', 0);
        errorLogGr.setValue('response_time_ms', 0);
        errorLogGr.insert();

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: false,
          message: errorMsg,
          stack_trace: stackTrace,
        });
      }
    },

    type: 'EC2RemediationHelper',
  }
);]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_include</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-11 02:15:24</sys_created_on><sys_id>b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2RemediationHelper</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_package><sys_policy>read</sys_policy><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_include_b39b2b1330b322107f44536bdd6b1c02</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-12 05:28:55</sys_updated_on></sys_script_include></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_update_xml"><sys_update_xml action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><action>INSERT_OR_UPDATE</action><application display_value="">de47959e9f3322107f4424482024abbc</application><category>customer</category><comments/><name>sn_aia_agent_a4eb7e2d9f4032107f4424482024ab1b</name><payload><![CDATA[<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>EC2 remediation is the process of restarting a server through an API call. Your objective is to identify when an instance is off and turn it back on using a POST REST API request.
To remediate follow the steps below:
For the entire process, only accept yes or no responses. Frame your questions so they can always be answered with a simple yes or no. Yes means correct, and no means incorrect.
If the user enters an Instance ID, proceed to the first step. If the user enters an incident number, proceed to the third step.
First, find the details of the Instance ID using the Instance ID lookup Tool and present it to the user. You must use this format: Instance ID: Instance Name: Instance Status: Updated:
Second, if the Instance Status is OFF, then ask if the user would like to proceed to the EC2 Remediation Tool. If the Instance Status is ON, then tell the user the statement below then do not proceed: The EC2 Instance {instance_name} ({instance_id}) is currently {instance_status}. No remediation is required as of now. Thank you!
Third, find the details of the incident number using the Incident Record lookup Tool. Present the details to the user, you must use this format: Number: Short description: Caller: Description: State: Assigned to: Updated:
Fourth, verify the incident details. If the details are correct, proceed to the next step. If the details are incorrect, do not proceed and tell the user to check the Incident table for the Incident number.
Fifth, use the Instance ID lookup Tool and the instance id in the incident record short description to find the instance record. Present it to the user, you must use this format: Instance ID: Instance Name: Instance Status: Updated:
Sixth, verify the Instance ID record. If the Instance ID is correct, proceed to the next step. If the details are incorrect, do not proceed and tell the user to check the EC2 Instance table for the Instance ID.
Seventh, remediate the EC2 instance using the instance ID and EC2 Remediation Tool. Proceed to step eight.
Eighth, summarize the output from EC2 instance remediation.
Ninth, if remediation is successful, then close out the incident using the Record update Tool. Present the updated incident details, you must use this format: Number: Short Description: State: Resolved: Resolve time: Resolved by: Resolution notes:
Tenth, if remediation is unsuccessful, use the Instance ID lookup Tool. If the Instance Status is ON, then tell the user: The EC2 Instance {instance_name} ({instance_id}) is currently {instance_status}. No remediation is required as of now. Thank you!
Eleventh, end with a thank you note. Do not repeat responses.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent is an expert in EC2 remediation, tasked with reading incident descriptions, identifying EC2 instance IDs, requesting human approval, and executing remediation using a scripting tool. The agent's primary function is to ensure EC2 instances are operational by restarting them when necessary. - The agent utilizes the EC2 Remediation Tool to translate instance IDs from conversation into sys_ids for API calls, ensuring seamless integration with the existing database structure and logging through RemediationHelper. This tool is vital for executing the remediation process effectively. - The agent uses the Incident Record lookup tool to retrieve and verify incident details from the incident table, ensuring that the correct instance is identified for remediation. This tool helps the agent maintain accuracy and reliability in the remediation process. - The agent follows a detailed ACTION PLAN for EC2 remediation, which includes verifying instance and incident details, using lookup tools, executing remediation, and summarizing outcomes. This structured approach ensures thoroughness and accuracy in the remediation process. - The agent requests human approval before proceeding with remediation actions, ensuring that all steps are authorized and appropriate. This capability aligns with the ACTION PLAN's emphasis on verification and accuracy. - The agent summarizes the output from EC2 instance remediation, providing clear feedback and closure to the user. This capability ensures transparency and accountability in the remediation process.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You're an expert in EC2 remediation and are tasked to read incident descriptions, identify EC2 instance IDs, request human approval, and execute remediation using a scripting tool.</role><run_as/><strategy sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_update_xml"><sys_update_xml action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><action>INSERT_OR_UPDATE</action><application display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</application><category>customer</category><comments/><name>sn_aia_tool_1af417259fc032107f440f42b824ab46</name><payload><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>EC2 remediation</description><input_schema>[{"name":"instance_id","description":""}]</input_schema><name>EC2 remediation tool</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[function trigger_EC2_Remediation() {
  var recordSysId = g_form.getUniqueValue();

  if (!recordSysId) {
    alert('Unable to get record ID');
    return;
  }

  var ga = new GlideAjax('x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2RemediationHelper');
  ga.addParam('sysparm_name', 'triggerRemediation');
  ga.addParam('sysparm_ec2_sys_id', recordSysId);

  ga.getXMLAnswer(function (answer) {
    if (!answer) {
      alert('No response from server. Check the Remediation Log for details.');
      return;
    }

    if (answer.indexOf('"success":true') !== -1) {
      alert('Remediation request submitted successfully!');
    } else {
      alert(
        'Remediation request failed. Check the Remediation Log for error details.'
      );
    }

    g_form.reload();
  });
}]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 00:22:31</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>1af417259fc032107f440f42b824ab46</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 remediation tool</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_1af417259fc032107f440f42b824ab46</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 23:31:39</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table/><type>script</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update></payload><payload_hash>-1315182841</payload_hash><remote_update_set/><replace_on_upgrade>false</replace_on_upgrade><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 00:22:31</sys_created_on><sys_id>56f457e59f0432107f440f42b824ab63</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_recorded_at>1996451b2c60000001</sys_recorded_at><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 23:31:39</sys_updated_on><table/><target_name>EC2 remediation tool</target_name><type>Tool</type><update_domain>global</update_domain><update_guid>b48c195eb440321020ef8a8815c8cce6</update_guid><update_guid_history>b48c195eb440321020ef8a8815c8cce6:-1315182841,52f457e53f04321042c7098e24db3d63:427952473</update_guid_history><update_set display_value="EC2 Monitiring and Remediation 2 ">8d17728b9fbb22107f440f42b824abaa</update_set><view/></sys_update_xml></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_update_xml"><sys_update_xml action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><action>INSERT_OR_UPDATE</action><application display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</application><category>customer</category><comments/><name>sn_aia_tool_5171dbed9f8032107f440f42b824ab40</name><payload><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Server-side Script Include for API integration and remediation calls to the AWS Integration Server</description><input_schema>[{"name":"instance_id","description":"instance id"}]</input_schema><name>script tool using  RemediationHelper logic</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[var EC2RemediationHelper = Class.create();
EC2RemediationHelper.prototype = Object.extendsObject(
  global.AbstractAjaxProcessor,
  {
    triggerRemediation: function () {
      var ec2SysId = this.getParameter('sysparm_ec2_sys_id');

      try {
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: ec2SysId=' + ec2SysId);

        if (!ec2SysId) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'Missing required parameter: sysparm_ec2_sys_id',
          });
        }

        // Look up the EC2 instance record
        var ec2Gr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_instance');
        if (!ec2Gr.get(ec2SysId)) {
          return JSON.stringify({
            success: false,
            message: 'EC2 Instance record not found',
          });
        }

        var instanceId = ec2Gr.getValue('instance_id');
        gs.info('EC2RemediationHelper: Found instanceId=' + instanceId);

        // Get credentials from connection store
        var aliasGr = new GlideRecord('sys_alias');
        aliasGr.addQuery('name', 'AWS Integration Server C C Alias');
        aliasGr.query();
        aliasGr.next();
        var aliasSysId = aliasGr.getUniqueValue();

        var connectionInfo =
          new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider().getConnectionInfoByDomain(
            aliasSysId,
            'global'
          );
        var username = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('user_name');
        var password = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute('password');
        var connectionUrl = connectionInfo.getAttribute('connection_url');

        // Make API call
        var request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2();
        request.setEndpoint(connectionUrl);
        request.setHttpMethod('POST');
        request.setBasicAuth(username, password);
        request.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
        request.setRequestHeader('Accept', 'application/json');

        var requestBody = JSON.stringify({instance_id: instanceId});
        request.setRequestBody(requestBody);

        var startTime = new Date().getTime();
        var response = request.execute();
        var endTime = new Date().getTime();
        var responseTime = endTime - startTime;

        var httpStatusCode = response.getStatusCode();
        var responseBody = response.getBody();
        var errorMessage = response.getErrorMessage();
        var isSuccess = httpStatusCode >= 200 && httpStatusCode < 300;

        gs.info(
          'EC2RemediationHelper: API Response - Status: ' +
            httpStatusCode +
            ', Body: ' +
            responseBody
        );

        // error message with details
        var fullErrorMessage = null;
        if (!isSuccess) {
          fullErrorMessage = 'API call failed - HTTP ' + httpStatusCode;
          if (errorMessage) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nError: ' + errorMessage;
          }
          if (responseBody) {
            fullErrorMessage += '\nResponse: ' + responseBody;
          }
        }

        // Create remediation log entry
        var logGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        logGr.initialize();
        logGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId);
        logGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        logGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        logGr.setValue('request_payload', requestBody);
        logGr.setValue('success', isSuccess);
        logGr.setValue('response_payload', responseBody);
        logGr.setValue('http_status_code', httpStatusCode);
        logGr.setValue('response_time_ms', responseTime);

        if (fullErrorMessage) {
          logGr.setValue('error_message', fullErrorMessage);
        }

        var logId = logGr.insert();
        gs.info('Created log entry: ' + logId);

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: isSuccess,
          message: isSuccess
            ? 'Instance start request sent successfully!'
            : fullErrorMessage,
          log_id: logId,
          instance_id: instanceId,
          http_status: httpStatusCode,
          response_time_ms: responseTime,
        });
      } catch (e) {
        var errorMsg = 'Exception in triggerRemediation: ' + e.message;
        var stackTrace = e.stack || 'Stack trace not available';

        gs.error('EC2RemediationHelper error: ' + errorMsg);
        gs.error('Stack trace: ' + stackTrace);

        // Log error with full stack trace
        var errorLogGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        errorLogGr.initialize();
        errorLogGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId || 'unknown');
        errorLogGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        errorLogGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        errorLogGr.setValue('success', false);
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'response_payload',
          'Exception: ' + errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue(
          'error_message',
          errorMsg + '\n\nStack Trace:\n' + stackTrace
        );
        errorLogGr.setValue('http_status_code', 0);
        errorLogGr.setValue('response_time_ms', 0);
        errorLogGr.insert();

        return JSON.stringify({
          success: false,
          message: errorMsg,
          stack_trace: stackTrace,
        });
      }
    },

    type: 'EC2RemediationHelper',
  }
);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 00:07:10</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>5171dbed9f8032107f440f42b824ab40</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_name>script tool using  RemediationHelper logic</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">0517728b9fbb22107f440f42b824aba6</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_5171dbed9f8032107f440f42b824ab40</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 23:15:49</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><type>script</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update></payload><payload_hash>-559154328</payload_hash><remote_update_set/><replace_on_upgrade>false</replace_on_upgrade><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 00:07:10</sys_created_on><sys_id>9d71d3ed9fc032107f440f42b824ab9e</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_recorded_at>1996443345b0000001</sys_recorded_at><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 23:15:50</sys_updated_on><table/><target_name>script tool using  RemediationHelper logic</target_name><type>Tool</type><update_domain>global</update_domain><update_guid>4de8d1566a40321007c4ca5cd249f79d</update_guid><update_guid_history>4de8d1566a40321007c4ca5cd249f79d:-559154328,5971d3edafc0321048cb45f3ed03bd9e:1105493368</update_guid_history><update_set display_value="EC2 Monitiring and Remediation 2 ">8d17728b9fbb22107f440f42b824abaa</update_set><view/></sys_update_xml></record_update>

encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>Configure agent to read incident descriptions, identify EC2 instance IDs, request human approval, and execute remediation using your existing API integration</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent specializes in EC2 remediation within DevOps operations, focusing on identifying and resolving issues related to EC2 instances efficiently and effectively. - The agent is capable of parsing incident descriptions to extract relevant EC2 instance IDs, ensuring that the correct instances are targeted for remediation. - The agent can request human approval for remediation actions, ensuring that all operations are verified and authorized before execution. - The agent utilizes the 'script tool using RemediationHelper logic' to perform API integration and execute remediation calls to the AWS Integration Server, leveraging server-side scripting for efficient operations. - The agent employs the 'EC2 remediation tool' to directly address and resolve issues with EC2 instances, ensuring optimal performance and reliability. - The agent uses the 'Incident Update' tool to modify incident details, including category, subcategory, and CI, ensuring that all updates are accurately reflected in the system post-remediation.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>EC2 remediation specialist for DevOps operations</role><run_as/><strategy
